text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- King Hussein, Crown Prince Hassan discuss with Norwegian foreign minister activating the peace process.
- Amman stock market jumps above the one million dinar ($1.4 million) trading volume and activity strongest on Jordan Phosphates and Arab Potash.
- Resignation of the Israeli ambassador in Amman only four days after his appointment.
- Cabinet approves a new tariff structure for water which favours low income consumers.
- Ugly killing in Karak; father kills wife and his four children in honour killing.
- Fifteeen thousand tonnes of U.S. rice for the domestic market arrive on Wednesday in the Red Sea port of Aqaba.
- Fear of major losses by agro-businesses in the south of the country; companies submit memorandum to the government over problems they are facing because of bureacratic obstacles.
- Customs department reduce fines on customs violations to ease procedures.
- Trade minister says prices of agricultural produce begin to drop after floating retail prices.
- King receives freed Hamas leader Musa Abu Marzook.
- Jordan sends aid to Iranian earthquake victims.
